overview: Fractions are a key part of the PSLE syllabus. Students must be able to compare, simplify, add, subtract, multiply, and divide fractions, convert between improper fractions and mixed numbers, and solve word problems involving fractions, in line with the Singapore MOE requirements.
objectives: Compare and order fractions with like and unlike denominators
Add and subtract fractions with like and unlike denominators
Multiply and divide fractions and mixed numbers
Convert between improper fractions and mixed numbers
Solve word problems involving fractions (including of a set, remainder, and difference)
refresher: A fraction a/b means a parts out of b equal parts. To simplify, divide numerator and denominator by their greatest common factor (GCF). For addition/subtraction, use a common denominator. For multiplication, multiply numerators and denominators. For division, multiply by the reciprocal of the divisor.
